item.title: Limits
item.description: $$ \begin{aligned} \text{Tính: }& L = \lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(\frac{x+1}{x+3}\bigg)^{x}\\ \text{Giải: } & \\ \text{Ta có: }& \\ L&=\lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(\frac{x+1}{x+3}\bigg)^x \\ &= \lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(\frac{x+3-2}{x+3}\bigg)^x \\ &= \lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(1 + \frac{-2}{x+3}\bigg)^x \\ \text{Đặt: } u&=\frac{-2}{x+3} \\ &\Leftrightarrow x+3 = \frac{-2}{u} \\ &\Leftrightarrow x = \frac{-2}{u} - 3 \\ \text{Vì: } &\lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(\frac{-2}{x+3}\bigg) = 0 \Rightarrow \lim_{x \to +\infty}u = \lim_{u \to 0}u = 0 \\ \text{Do đó: } &\\ L &= \lim_{x \to +\infty}\bigg(1 + \frac{-2}{x+3}\bigg)^x \\ &= \lim_{u \to 0}\bigg(1+u\bigg)^{\frac{-2}{u} -3} \\ &= \lim_{u \to 0}\bigg(1+u\bigg)^{\frac{-2}{u}}.
